bioghist.p: Alma C. Clarke (b. 1890) was a kindergarten teacher who volunteered in 1917 to work in France. Under the auspices of the Committee France America for the Protection of the Children of the Frontier, she cared for war orphans in a number of locales, notably the Colonie Franco-Americaine du Chateau de la Cour Cheille, Indre-et-Loire. In 1918 she was recruited by the Red Cross to work as an auxiliary nurse in the American Red Cross Hospital at Neuilly-sur-Seine. She remained at that post until June 1919.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes correspondence, scrapbooks, photographs, postcards, clippings, memorabilia, and printed material collected by Clarke during her service in France. Of particular note are Clarke's annotated scrapbooks of wounded soldiers and war orphans. Both scrapbooks include notes and drawings by Clarke's patients, photographs of patients and staff, and various memorabilia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
